intro: Coleocoma centaurea, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Coleocoma centaurea is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
